required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Compare Bosutinib To Imatinib In Subjects With Newly Diagnosed Chronic Phase Philadelphia Chromosome Positive CML
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Randomized, Open-label Study Of Bosutinib Versus Imatinib In Subjects With Newly Diagnosed Chronic Phase Philadelphia Chromosome Positive Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia

collaborator.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Two-arm, randomized, open-label trial designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of bosutinib alone compared to imatinib alone in subjects newly diagnosed with chronic phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML). The primary endpoint is cytogenetic response rate at one year.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) at Year 1
primary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic Response (CyR) is based on the prevalence of Philadelphia chromosome positive (Ph+) metaphases among cells in metaphase on a bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) was achieved when there was 0 percent (%) Ph+ metaphases among cells in a BM sample when at least 20 metaphases from a BM sample were analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Major Molecular Response (MMR) at Year 1
secondary_outcome.description: Molecular response was assessed using breakpoint cluster region - Abelson proto-oncogene (Bcr-Abl) transcript levels measured by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) from peripheral blood. A major molecular response (MMR) is defined as a ratio Bcr-Abl/Abl less than or equal to (=<) 0.1% on the international scale [greater than or equal to (>=) 3 log reduction from baseline in ratio of Bcr-Abl to Abl transcripts].

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 weeks in Year 1, every 24 weeks in Years 2 and 3 and every 48 weeks for Year 4 through 5
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of CCyR was measured from the first date of response until the first date of loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. CyR is based on the prevalence of Ph+ metaphases among cells in metaphase on a bone marrow sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) was achieved when there was 0% Ph+ metaphases among cells in a bone marrow sample when at least 20 metaphases from a BM sample were analyzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 4 weeks up to Week 20 thereafter every 12 weeks until 7 to 28 days after last dose of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of CHR was measured from the first date of response until the first date of loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. Complete CHR: White Blood Cells =<institutional upper limit of normal [20*10^9 per liter (/L)], no peripheral blasts or promyelocytes, myelocytes + metamyelocytes <5% in blood, absolute neutrophil count >=1.0*10^9/L, platelets <450*10^9/L, <20% basophils in blood and no extramedually involvement (including hepato- or spleno- megaly).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 weeks for Years 1 and 2 and every 24 weeks for Year 3 through 5
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of MMR was measured from the first date of response until the first date loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. Molecular response was assessed using Bcr-Abl transcript levels measured by RT-PCR from peripheral blood. MMR is defined as a ratio Bcr-Abl/Abl =< 0.1% on the international scale (>= 3 log reduction from baseline in ratio of Bcr-Abl to Abl transcripts).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose) on Day 1, 28, 56 and 84 and 3, 6 hours post-dose on Day 1 and 28
secondary_outcome.description: Data for this Outcome Measure are not reported here because the analysis population includes participants who were not enrolled in this study. ClinicalTrials.gov is designed for reporting results from only those participants who were enrolled in the study and described in the Participant Flow and Baseline Characteristics modules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Transformation to Accelerated Phase (AP) or Blast Phase (BP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization (Week 0) up to first confirmed transformation to AP/BP phase or 7 to 28 days after last dose of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: Time to transformation to AP/BP was defined as the time from randomization to the first date of transformation to AP or BP while on study treatment. Criteria for transformation to AP: 15 to 29% blasts; >= 30% blasts + promyelocytes; >=20% basophils in blood or bone marrow; platelets <100*10^9/L, in blood. Criteria for transformation to BP: >=30% blasts in blood or bone marrow and extramedullary involvement other than liver or spleen (example: chloromas).

intervention.description: 500 mg once daily, by mouth (tablet) with food preferably in the morning. Drug can be increased up to 600mg daily in case of lack of efficacy, and can be reduced to 300mg daily in case of toxicity. The drug will be given daily for up to 8 years until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death or withdrawal of consent.

400 mg once daily, by mouth (tablet). Drug can be increased up to 600mg daily in case of lack of efficacy, and can be reduced to 300mg daily in case of toxicity. The drug will be given daily for up to 8 years until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death or withdrawal of consent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cytogenetic diagnosis of chronic phase Ph+ CML diagnosed less than 6 months.
- Diagnosis of CML chronic phase confirmed.
- Adequate hepatic and renal function.
- Able to take oral tablets.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusions include Philadelphia negative CML.
- Prior anti-leukemia treatment.
- Prior stem cell transplant.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Bosutinib
group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to bosutinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to bosutinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

group.title: Imatinib
group.description: Imatinib 400 mg tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to imatinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to imatinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) at Year 1
outcome.description: Cytogenetic Response (CyR) is based on the prevalence of Philadelphia chromosome positive (Ph+) metaphases among cells in metaphase on a bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) was achieved when there was 0 percent (%) Ph+ metaphases among cells in a BM sample when at least 20 metaphases from a BM sample were analyzed.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all participants who were randomized in the study.

measure.description: Cytogenetic Response (CyR) is based on the prevalence of Philadelphia chromosome positive (Ph+) metaphases among cells in metaphase on a bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) was achieved when there was 0 percent (%) Ph+ metaphases among cells in a BM sample when at least 20 metaphases from a BM sample were analyzed.

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value was based on a Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test for general association between treatment and responder with stratification by Sokal risk group (low, intermediate, high) and region.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Major Molecular Response (MMR) at Year 1
outcome.description: Molecular response was assessed using breakpoint cluster region - Abelson proto-oncogene (Bcr-Abl) transcript levels measured by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) from peripheral blood. A major molecular response (MMR) is defined as a ratio Bcr-Abl/Abl less than or equal to (=<) 0.1% on the international scale [greater than or equal to (>=) 3 log reduction from baseline in ratio of Bcr-Abl to Abl transcripts].

outcome.title: Duration of Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
outcome.description: Duration of CCyR was measured from the first date of response until the first date of loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. CyR is based on the prevalence of Ph+ metaphases among cells in metaphase on a bone marrow sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) was achieved when there was 0% Ph+ metaphases among cells in a bone marrow sample when at least 20 metaphases from a BM sample were analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: Every 12 weeks in Year 1, every 24 weeks in Years 2 and 3 and every 48 weeks for Year 4 through 5
outcome.population: Subgroup of participants from ITT population who had CCyR.

group.title: Bosutinib
group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to bosutinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to bosutinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

measure.title: Duration of Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
measure.description: Duration of CCyR was measured from the first date of response until the first date of loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. CyR is based on the prevalence of Ph+ metaphases among cells in metaphase on a bone marrow sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) was achieved when there was 0% Ph+ metaphases among cells in a bone marrow sample when at least 20 metaphases from a BM sample were analyzed.

measurement_list.measurement: Median time was not attained as very few participants from bosutinib arm group with CCyR experienced a loss of CCyR or treatment failure.
Median time was not attained as very few participants from imatinib arm group with CCyR experienced a loss of CCyR or treatment failure.

outcome.title: Duration of Complete Hematologic Response (CHR)
outcome.description: Duration of CHR was measured from the first date of response until the first date of loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. Complete CHR: White Blood Cells =<institutional upper limit of normal [20*10^9 per liter (/L)], no peripheral blasts or promyelocytes, myelocytes + metamyelocytes <5% in blood, absolute neutrophil count >=1.0*10^9/L, platelets <450*10^9/L, <20% basophils in blood and no extramedually involvement (including hepato- or spleno- megaly).
outcome.time_frame: Every 4 weeks up to Week 20 thereafter every 12 weeks until 7 to 28 days after last dose of study medication
outcome.population: Subgroup of participants from ITT population who had CHR.

group.title: Bosutinib
group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to bosutinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to bosutinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

group.title: Imatinib
group.description: Imatinib 400 mg tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to imatinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to imatinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

measure.title: Duration of Complete Hematologic Response (CHR)
measure.description: Duration of CHR was measured from the first date of response until the first date of loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. Complete CHR: White Blood Cells =<institutional upper limit of normal [20*10^9 per liter (/L)], no peripheral blasts or promyelocytes, myelocytes + metamyelocytes <5% in blood, absolute neutrophil count >=1.0*10^9/L, platelets <450*10^9/L, <20% basophils in blood and no extramedually involvement (including hepato- or spleno- megaly).

measurement_list.measurement: Median time was not attained as very few participants from bosutinib arm group with CHR experienced a loss of CHR or disease progression.
Median time was not attained as very few participants from imatinib arm group with CHR experienced a loss of CHR or disease progression.

outcome.title: Duration of Major Molecular Response (MMR)
outcome.description: Duration of MMR was measured from the first date of response until the first date loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. Molecular response was assessed using Bcr-Abl transcript levels measured by RT-PCR from peripheral blood. MMR is defined as a ratio Bcr-Abl/Abl =< 0.1% on the international scale (>= 3 log reduction from baseline in ratio of Bcr-Abl to Abl transcripts).
outcome.time_frame: Every 12 weeks for Years 1 and 2 and every 24 weeks for Year 3 through 5
outcome.population: Subgroup of participants from ITT population who had MMR.

group.title: Bosutinib
group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to bosutinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to bosutinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

group.title: Imatinib
group.description: Imatinib 400 mg tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to imatinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to imatinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

measure.title: Duration of Major Molecular Response (MMR)
measure.description: Duration of MMR was measured from the first date of response until the first date loss of response, objectively documented. Duration of response was calculated using only participants who responded to study medication. Molecular response was assessed using Bcr-Abl transcript levels measured by RT-PCR from peripheral blood. MMR is defined as a ratio Bcr-Abl/Abl =< 0.1% on the international scale (>= 3 log reduction from baseline in ratio of Bcr-Abl to Abl transcripts).

measurement_list.measurement: Median time was not attained as very few participants from bosutinib arm group with MMR experienced a loss of MMR or disease progression.
Median time was not attained as very few participants from imatinib arm group with MMR experienced a loss of MMR or disease progression.

outcome.title: Population Pharmacokinetics
outcome.description: Data for this Outcome Measure are not reported here because the analysis population includes participants who were not enrolled in this study. ClinicalTrials.gov is designed for reporting results from only those participants who were enrolled in the study and described in the Participant Flow and Baseline Characteristics modules.
outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose) on Day 1, 28, 56 and 84 and 3, 6 hours post-dose on Day 1 and 28

outcome.title: Time to Transformation to Accelerated Phase (AP) or Blast Phase (BP)
outcome.description: Time to transformation to AP/BP was defined as the time from randomization to the first date of transformation to AP or BP while on study treatment. Criteria for transformation to AP: 15 to 29% blasts; >= 30% blasts + promyelocytes; >=20% basophils in blood or bone marrow; platelets <100*10^9/L, in blood. Criteria for transformation to BP: >=30% blasts in blood or bone marrow and extramedullary involvement other than liver or spleen (example: chloromas).
outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization (Week 0) up to first confirmed transformation to AP/BP phase or 7 to 28 days after last dose of study medication
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized in the study.

group.title: Bosutinib
group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to bosutinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to bosutinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

group.title: Imatinib
group.description: Imatinib 400 mg tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to imatinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to imatinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

measure.title: Time to Transformation to Accelerated Phase (AP) or Blast Phase (BP)
measure.description: Time to transformation to AP/BP was defined as the time from randomization to the first date of transformation to AP or BP while on study treatment. Criteria for transformation to AP: 15 to 29% blasts; >= 30% blasts + promyelocytes; >=20% basophils in blood or bone marrow; platelets <100*10^9/L, in blood. Criteria for transformation to BP: >=30% blasts in blood or bone marrow and extramedullary involvement other than liver or spleen (example: chloromas).

measurement_list.measurement: Median time for bosutinib was not estimable as there were too few participants who experienced the AP/BP transformation.
Median time for imatinib was not estimable as there were too few participants who experienced the AP/BP transformation.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Bosutinib
group.description: Bosutinib 500 milligram (mg) tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to bosutinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to bosutinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

group.title: Imatinib
group.description: Imatinib 400 mg tablet orally once daily up to 5 years or until treatment failure, unacceptable toxicity, death, withdrawal of consent. Dose adjustments, if needed, included an escalation to imatinib 600 mg tablet orally once daily or a reduction to imatinib 300 mg tablet orally once daily.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
